data.title: custom action can not use reverse and clone
data.body:
custom action can not use reverse and clone

reverse and clone will return the custom action's parent.

right design:
reverse and clone need return the custom action.

data.title: v3.7 LayerLoader not support touch one by one
Desktop and WinRT use correct keyboard codes
data.body:
Desktop:
GLFW_KEY_ENTER equals KEY_ENTER ( GLFW_KEY_KP_ENTER = KEY_KP_ENTER)
WinRT:
VK_PRIOR equals KEY_PG_UP ( not KEY_KP_PG_UP )

data.title: [ci skip]Correct contribution in v3.8
TextFieldTTF support text cursor
data.body:
Add StringUtils::StringUTF8 for easy manipulate utf8 string.
If TextField active(focused input text) show text cursor( default '|',
change TextFieldTTF::setCursorChar ).
Show/Hide interval CURSOR_TIME_SHOW_HIDE
Change position text cursor control key: KEY_HOME, KEY_END,
KEY_LEFT_ARROW, KEY_RIGHT_ARROW
CC_PLATFORM_MAC,  CC_PLATFORM_WIN32, CC_PLATFORM_LINUX default use
cursor( For change state TextFieldTTF::setCursorUse )
Desktop implement dispatchControlKey
WinRT support key repeat and implement dispatchControlKey

data.title: WinRT support mouse
data.body:
Show/Hide mouse cursor.
Mouse event implemented similar Desktop version.
Left button send mouse event and touch.
Support other mouse button and scroll wheel.

data.title: fix Slider create missing res type.
data.body: fixed https://github.com/cocos2d/cocos2d-x/issues/13575

data.title: Adding a namespace for actions and maybe UI nodes
data.body:
Maybe I'm doing it wrong, but it would it would be great to have either a namespace or some sort of a prefix for actions.
On Sprite-Kit, Apple solved it by adding all the actions on a single class as a static method. 

Obviously, that's to work around the fact that Obj-C is missing Namespaces, but I feel like C++ could solve that better.
At least making it easier to explore available node types, UI and Actions.

data.title: Android app freezes sometimes because Cocos2dxRenderer.nativeOnResume() is not called when the activity is resumed.

milestone.title: v3.8
milestone.description:
This version is planned to only "fix existing bugs" and "unfinished tasks".
We need to improve the quality after a 3D rush in v3.6 and v3.7.

data.body:
`Cocos2dxRenderer.nativeOnResume()` is supposed to be called when the activity is resumed. It is called through by `Cocos2dxActivity.onWindowFocusChanged()`.

I found a case that `onWindowFocusChanged()` is not being called after `onResume()`. It causes the app to freeze.

Normally `onWindowFocusChanged(false)` is called right after `onPause()` and `onWindowFocusChanged(true)` right after `onResume()`.
But if the device's display is turned off by itself because of screen timeout, a time gap is generated between `onPause()` and `onWindowFocusChanged(false)` like following. In this case, It took 7 seconds. Test device was Samsung Galaxy S4(SHV-E300S).

```
08-27 16:39:42.561: D/Cocos2dxActivity(26545): onPause()
08-27 16:39:49.646: D/Cocos2dxActivity(26545): onWindowFocusChanged() hasFocus=false
08-27 16:39:52.761: D/Cocos2dxActivity(26545): onResume()
08-27 16:39:53.166: D/Cocos2dxActivity(26545): onWindowFocusChanged() hasFocus=true
```

If user turns on the display in the time gap right after `onPause()`, `onResume()` is called right then. It leads `onWindowFocusChanged(true)` not to be called because the activity hasn't lose focus.

```
08-27 16:40:09.651: D/Cocos2dxActivity(26545): onPause()
08-27 16:40:10.586: D/Cocos2dxActivity(26545): onResume()
```

In this case, `Cocos2dxRenderer.nativeOnResume()` is not being called and the app freezes.

data.title: V3.8: Win10 UWP platform fixes

milestone.title: v3.8
milestone.description:
This version is planned to only "fix existing bugs" and "unfinished tasks".
We need to improve the quality after a 3D rush in v3.6 and v3.7.

data.body:
This pull request makes some minor changes to the Windows 10 UWP version of cocos2d-x.
1. isWindowsPhone() check was added to help identify Windows 10 Phone
2. fixed pdb file output for Win10 UWP libspline project to remove compiler warnings in ARM builds.
